conclusion: Acceleration in a v-t graph is given by the slope of the tangent line.
Acceleration first increasing then decreasing means da/dt is positive then negative.
The derivative of acceleration is the second derivative of velocity, determining graph concavity.
Examine v-t graphs for objects A and B during 0 to t1 for curvature.
v-t graphs for both objects A and B are concave downwards throughout 0 to t1.
Concave downwards graphs imply negative second derivative for both objects.
Negative second derivative means acceleration is decreasing throughout 0 to t1.
Acceleration cannot be first increasing and then decreasing if always decreasing.
The statement that accelerations are first increasing then decreasing is false.
